== Examples ==
== Examples ==
â
*[[deb (file format)|deb]] — '''Deb'''ian package, originally from [[Debian]]. Used by Debian and derivatives such as [[Ubuntu (Linux distribution)|Ubuntu]].
+
*[[deb (file format)|deb]] — '''Deb'''ian package, originally from [[Debian]]. Used by Debian and derivatives such as [[Ubuntu (operating system)|ubuntu]].
*[[ebuild]] — the file containing information on how to retrieve, compile, and install a package in [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]]'s [[Portage (software)|Portage]] system using the command [[emerge]]. Typically these are source-primary installs, though binary packages can be installed in this fashion as well. Gentoo-based distributions also use the ebuild system from the same Portage tree.
*[[ebuild]] — the file containing information on how to retrieve, compile, and install a package in [[Gentoo Linux|Gentoo]]'s [[Portage (software)|Portage]] system using the command [[emerge]]. Typically these are source-primary installs, though binary packages can be installed in this fashion as well. Gentoo-based distributions also use the ebuild system from the same Portage tree.
*[[RPM Package Manager|RPM]] — '''R'''ed Hat '''P'''ackage '''M'''anager, originally from [[Red Hat]], is now used by many other distributors as well, like [[openSUSE]] and [[Mandriva Linux]].
*[[RPM Package Manager|RPM]] — '''R'''ed Hat '''P'''ackage '''M'''anager, originally from [[Red Hat]], is now used by many other distributors as well, like [[openSUSE]] and [[Mandriva Linux]].
